answers.author: Robert Kiely
answers.text:
Matt, the City of Lake Forest, IL recently offered and ERI through the Illinois Municipal Retirement Fund (IMRF). The net reduction in positions was 7 resulting in over $400,000 in annual savings. An added benefit was new hires are under a less generous (expensive) pension plan.

answers.author: Roberta Kimelton
answers.text:
Matt,
Please find attached information regarding the City of Peoria's retirement plan/voluntary severance plans used to address budget deficits.  Please note that the retirement incentive is not an early retirement incentive, but rather an incentive for individuals who were already retirement eligible.  This incentive did not address individuals who were in public safety.  Also, you want to verify the impact on your retirement system as to whether implementing such a program creates an unfunded liability.  Hope this helps.

author: Matthew McQuillen
text:
I am performing some research on cities that have developed and implemented an early retirement program over the past few years as a way to save money and fill budget deficits.  If you are a City that has implemented such a program I would be interested to see what your policy is/was, including payout program, insurance and any other benefits.
Thanks,
Matt McQuillen
City of Clive
title: Early Retirement Programs
